AGT Mendon Scheduled to CapacityNovember The Tennessee Gas Pipeline Mendon Interconnect MR has been scheduled to the capacity that Algonquin AGT can accept into the AGT system for gas day November Receipts at the Mendon interconnect will be restricted to the capacity of Dth for gas day Saturday November Please contact your Operations Account Manager if you have any questions NOTE Duke Energy Gas Transmission respects your online time and privacy You have received this email because you elected to subscribe To unsubscribe login to the Email Notification Subscription page at scriptNotificationasp uncheck the appropriate checkbox and click the Submit button

TE Capacity for length restrictedNovember Weather forecasts would indicate low demand conditions through the Thanksgiving Holidays TEXAS EASTERN TRANSMISSION TE is facing high line pack levels and full storage Thus the pipe has severely restricted ability to absorb dueshipper gas Effective immediately and continuing through the end of the month TE is requiring that All shippers ensure their physical receipts do not exceed physical deliveries Receipt operators are expected to not flow above scheduled volumes Delivery meters are expected to take all gas scheduled Any customer who is long should take immediate action to resolve dueshipper positions No duepipeline makeup gas may be scheduled OBA parties should ensure that physical takes match scheduled nominations Dueshipper makeup gas may be scheduled through your Operations Account Manager These restrictions are expected to be in effect until further notice Please contact your Operations Account Manager if you have any questions NOTE Duke Energy Gas Transmission respects your online time and privacy You have received this email because you elected to subscribe To unsubscribe login to the Email Notification Subscription page at scriptNotificationasp uncheck the appropriate checkbox and click the Submit button

AGT Critical System WarningNovember As indicated by the Critical System Warning issued November based on anticipated system operations and weather conditions as stated below ALGONQUIN GAS TRANSMISSION AGT is requiring that all customers take immediate and prompt steps to eliminate excess receipts and to conform scheduled receipts to actual deliveries This Critical System Warning shall remain in place until further notice Weather continues to be unseasonably mild and shippers have been scheduling gas in excess of actual takes As a result there is no line pack available for system operational purposes and AGT cannot continue to absorb actual imbalances left on the system AGT will continue to closely monitor current pipeline conditions To the extent necessary AGT will contact customers on an individual basis regarding additional action by AGT to protect system operations AGT recommends that all customers rank both their supplies and their markets in the event that systemwide reductions are required To the extent AGT and customers are unable to agree upon appropriate action within a reasonable time AGT may adjust customers nominations and revise scheduled quantities immediately to halt the further accumulation of imbalances In addition AGT may take any actions within its operational capabilities to reduce excess receipts No due pipe imbalance makeup will be accepted until further notice Please contact your Operations Account Manager if you have any questions NOTE Duke Energy Gas Transmission respects your online time and privacy You have received this email because you elected to subscribe To unsubscribe login to the Email Notification Subscription page at scriptNotificationasp uncheck the appropriate checkbox and click the Submit button

TE Critical System WarningNovember As indicated by the Critical System Warning issued November based on anticipated system operations and weather conditions as stated below TEXAS EASTERN TRANSMISSION LP Texas Eastern is requiring that all customers take immediate and prompt steps to eliminate excess receipts and conform scheduled receipts to actual deliveries This systemwide warning is issued as a result of actual receipts into the system significantly exceeding actual deliveries This Critical System Warning shall remain in place until further notice Weather in the market area continues to be unseasonably mild and shippers have been filling contract storage inventories in anticipation of the coming winter heating season At this time Texas Easterns storage capacity is approximately full As a result there is virtually no storage capacity or linepack available for system operational purposes and Texas Eastern cannot continue to absorb actual imbalances left on the system Because of the critical nature of this situation and the fact that Texas Eastern no longer has the ability to further absorb imbalances being left on the system Texas Eastern requests that all customers coordinate with their suppliers the actual quantities received into the system to match actual customer takes in the market area No due pipe gas will be accepted into the system until further notice If immediate action does not result in reducing the current volume of gas being left on the system Texas Eastern may be forced to issue an operational flow order OFO requiring actual receipts of gas to match actual deliveries out of the system which will be subject to the OFO noncompliance penalty of per dekatherm In addition and as provided for in Texas Easterns FERC Gas Tariff Texas Eastern will take any other actions as may be necessary to protect the integrity of its system including but not limited to suspension of OBAs NOTE Duke Energy Gas Transmission respects your online time and privacy You have received this email because you elected to subscribe To unsubscribe login to the Email Notification Subscription page at scriptNotificationasp uncheck the appropriate checkbox and click the Submit button

AGT Critical System WarningNovember Effective immediately based on anticipated system operations and weather conditions as stated below ALGONQUIN GAS TRANSMISSION AGT is requiring that all customers take immediate and prompt steps to eliminate excess receipts and to conform scheduled receipts to actual deliveries Weather continues to be unseasonably mild and shippers have been scheduling gas in excess of actual takes As a result there is no line pack available for system operational purposes and AGT cannot continue to absorb actual imbalances left on the system AGT will continue to closely monitor current pipeline conditions To the extent necessary AGT will contact customers on an individual basis regarding additional action by AGT to protect system operations AGT recommends that all customers rank both their supplies and their markets in the event that systemwide reductions are required To the extent AGT and customers are unable to agree upon appropriate action within a reasonable time AGT may adjust customers nominations and revise scheduled quantities immediately to halt the further accumulation of imbalances In addition AGT may take any actions within its operational capabilities to reduce excess receipts No due pipe imbalance makeup will be accepted until further notice Please contact your Operations Account Manager if you have any questions NOTE Duke Energy Gas Transmission respects your online time and privacy You have received this email because you elected to subscribe To unsubscribe login to the Email Notification Subscription page at scriptNotificationasp uncheck the appropriate checkbox and click the Submit button

TE Critical System WarningNovember Texas Eastern Transmission LP Texas Eastern notifies all customers that for the reasons described below scheduled receipts into and deliveries out of the system must match actual receipts into and deliveries out of the system This systemwide warning is issued as a result of actual receipts into the system significantly exceeding actual deliveries Weather in the market area continues to be unseasonably mild and shippers have been filling contract storage inventories in anticipation of the coming winter heating season At this time Texas Easterns storage capacity is approximately full As a result there is virtually no storage capacity or linepack available for system operational purposes and Texas Eastern cannot continue to absorb actual imbalances left on the system Because of the critical nature of this situation and the fact that Texas Eastern no longer has the ability to further absorb imbalances being left on the system Texas Eastern requests that all customers coordinate with their suppliers the actual quantities received into the system to match actual customer takes in the market area If immediate action does not result in reducing the current volume of gas being left on the system Texas Eastern may be forced to issue an operational flow order OFO requiring actual receipts of gas to match actual deliveries out of the system which will be subject to the OFO noncompliance penalty of per dekatherm In addition and as provided for in Texas Easterns FERC Gas Tariff Texas Eastern will take any other actions as may be necessary to protect the integrity of its system including but not limited to suspension of OBAs NOTE Duke Energy Gas Transmission respects your online time and privacy You have received this email because you elected to subscribe To unsubscribe login to the Email Notification Subscription page at scriptNotificationasp uncheck the appropriate checkbox and click the Submit button

TE Restriction on Inch SystemPST January TEXAS EASTERN TRANSMISSION TE pipeline system was over scheduled on the inch system between Longview Compressor Station and Fagus Compressor Station for the weekend As a result TE restricted receipts between Longview and Pollard to the capacity that may move up the inch system No intraday nominations for gas leaving this area or for additional physical supply will be accepted These restrictions will be effective gas day January and remain in place throughout the weekend Please contact your Operations Account Manager if you have any questions NOTE Duke Energy Gas Transmission respects your online time and privacy You have received this email because you elected to subscribe To unsubscribe login to the Email Notification Subscription page at scriptNotificationasp uncheck the appropriate checkbox and click the Submit button

TE Storage Inventory LevelsPST On November Texas Eastern Transmission LP Texas Eastern notified firm storage customers that as required by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commissions November order in Docket No RP Texas Eastern would monitor customer storage activity and would issue customerspecific Operational Flow Orders OFOs prior to the issuance of a systemwide storage OFO pursuant to Section L of the General Terms and Conditions of Texas Easterns FERC Gas Tariff Sixth Revised Volume No Tariff As indicated in Texas Easterns November letter the need for a customer specific OFO would be determined based on such customers variance from the suggested storage withdrawal plan specified in the November mailing The Withdrawal Plan indicates the maximum recommended storage withdrawals for each of four withdrawal periods and is designed to reflect in the aggregate Texas Easterns historical utilization of its storage facilities prior to the implementation of the Commissions Order No Texas Eastern is not issuing a CustomerSpecific OFO at this time due to the high aggregate storage position at Texas Eastern will continue to monitor individual customer storage activity and may need to issue customerspecific OFOs if required by future circumstances Customerspecific OFOs will be based upon each customers variance from the suggested storage withdrawal plan provided to you and the other firm storage customers by letter dated November If you have any questions regarding the foregoing matters please contact your Account Manager NOTE Duke Energy Gas Transmission respects your online time and privacy You have received this email because you elected to subscribe To unsubscribe login to the Email Notification Subscription page at scriptNotificationasp uncheck the appropriate checkbox and click the Submit button

AGT Secondary RestrictionsPST January ALGONQUIN GAS TRANSMISSION AGT is experiencing an unscheduled horsepower outage at the Cromwell Compressor Station affecting mainline throughput Therefore effective gas day Wednesday January until further notice AGT is scheduled to capacity through this compressor station Only incremental Nonotice service will be accepted In addition no due shipper gas is available and no forward haul Authorized Overrun or IT downstream and through the Cromwell Compressor Station may be scheduled If you have any questions please contact your Operations Account Manager NOTE Duke Energy Gas Transmission respects your online time and privacy You have received this email because you elected to subscribe To unsubscribe login to the Email Notification Subscription page at scriptNotificationasp uncheck the appropriate checkbox and click the Submit button

TE Imbalance ResolutionPST January Moderating weather conditions on the TEXAS EASTERN TRANSMISSION TE pipeline system will allow a limited amount of Due Shipper pay back to be available over the weekend Shippers should schedule any imbalance payback with their Operations Account Manager Customers that are in a Due Pipe position should be scheduling imbalance makeup to the pipe through their Operations Account Manager All shippers and point operators should endeavor to stay balanced daily The opportunity to make up or pay back imbalances is entirely dependent on the operating conditions of the pipe from day to day Please contact your Operations Account Manager if you have any questions NOTE Duke Energy Gas Transmission respects your online time and privacy You have received this email because you elected to subscribe To unsubscribe login to the Email Notification Subscription page at scriptNotificationasp uncheck the appropriate checkbox and click the Submit button

TE PEPL Interconnect Outage DelayedOctober The previously posted outage of the Panhandle Eastern PEPL Interconnect on the Lebanon Lateral Meter station has been delayed The work will now take place beginning on Wednesday October at AM and will be completed on Friday November at PM There will be no gas entering the system from PEPL during this outage Texas Eastern TE is working with CMS to preinject customer gas into the system prior to the outage to mitigate any affect to TE shippers Texas Eastern will provide updates to this outage as they become available NOTE Duke Energy Gas Transmission respects your online time and privacy You have received this email because you elected to subscribe To unsubscribe login to the Email Notification Subscription page at scriptNotificationasp uncheck the appropriate checkbox and click the Submit button

TE Restriction for Oct October An unplanned outage at the ATHENS ATH Ohio Compressor station has occurred Due to high throughput levels already in the system and the restriction at ATH TEXAS EASTERN TRANSMISSION LP TE will not be accepting physical increases for Gas Day October upstream of ATH This would include the entire Access Area Market Zone Inch Inch Market Zone upstream of the ATH compressor station Due Pipe makeup cannot be accepted for Gas Day October These restrictions may be extended through the weekend Meter operators are reminded to flow at scheduled volumes Should you have any questions please contact your Operations Account Manager NOTE Duke Energy Gas Transmission respects your online time and privacy You have received this email because you elected to subscribe To unsubscribe login to the Email Notification Subscription page at scriptNotificationasp uncheck the appropriate checkbox and click the Submit button

TE Pipeline ConditionsOctober The Grand Chenier Compressor Station GCH will be taken off line at AM on October for planned maintenance The maintenance is scheduled to be completed by PM on October During this timeframe all producers on the Cameron System upstream of Grand Chenier will experience higher than normal line pressure although this outage will not require any platforms to shut in Please contact Steve Jenkins at if you have any questions NOTE Duke Energy Gas Transmission respects your online time and privacy You have received this email because you elected to subscribe To unsubscribe login to the Email Notification Subscription page at scriptNotificationasp uncheck the appropriate checkbox and click the Submit button

AGT Capacity for length restrictedNovember Extended weather forecasts portend low demand conditions for the next week to ten days Currently Algonquin Gas Transmission AGT is facing high line pack levels Thus the pipe has severely restricted ability to absorb dueshipper gas Effective immediately AGT is requesting that all shippers ensure that physical receipts do not exceed physical deliveries Receipt operators are expected to not flow above scheduled volumes Delivery meters are expected to take all gas scheduled Any customer who is long should take immediate action to resolve dueshipper positions No duepipeline makeup gas may be scheduled and OBA parties should ensure that physical takes match scheduled nominations Dueshipper makeup gas may be scheduled through your Operations Account Manager These restrictions are expected to be in effect until further notice Please contact your Operations Account Manager if you have any questions NOTE Duke Energy Gas Transmission respects your online time and privacy You have received this email because you elected to subscribe To unsubscribe login to the Email Notification Subscription page at scriptNotificationasp uncheck the appropriate checkbox and click the Submit button

TE Request for TABS AssistanceNovember Due to continued unseasonably mild weather and shippers filling contract storage inventories in anticipation of the coming winter heating season Texas Eastern has virtually no storage capacity or linepack available for system operational purposes and cannot continue to absorb imbalances left on the system Pursuant to Section of Rate Schedule TABS Texas Eastern offers to permit TABS Parties to decrease physical receipts of gas into the system by an aggregate quantity of Dthd Any decreases in gas receipts pursuant to Rate Schedule TABS will not reduce such TABS Parties scheduled deliveries whether at a TABS Service Point or city gate markets This request for decreased receipts under TABS is applicable for the STX ETX WLA and ELA TABS Service Points All requests for decreased receipts under Rate Schedule TABS will be accepted on a firstcome firstserved basis After Texas Easterns operational need for decreased receipts has passed Texas Eastern will notify all participating TABS Parties and such parties will have a reasonable time to come back into balance Any TABS party willing to decrease physical receipts into the system should contact their Account Manager NOTE Duke Energy Gas Transmission respects your online time and privacy You have received this email because you elected to subscribe To unsubscribe login to the Email Notification Subscription page at scriptNotificationasp uncheck the appropriate checkbox and click the Submit button

TE Critical System WarningNovember TEXAS EASTERN TRANSMISSION LP Texas Eastern continues to operate under the Critical System Warning issued November Based on anticipated system operations and weather conditions as stated below Texas Eastern is requiring that all customers take immediate and prompt steps to eliminate excess receipts and conform scheduled receipts to actual deliveries This systemwide warning is issued as a result of actual receipts into the system significantly exceeding actual deliveries This Critical System Warning shall remain in place until further notice Weather in the market area continues to be unseasonably mild and shippers have been filling contract storage inventories in anticipation of the coming winter heating season At this time Texas Easterns storage capacity is approximately full As a result there is virtually no storage capacity or line pack available for system operational purposes and Texas Eastern cannot continue to absorb actual imbalances left on the system Due to the critical nature of this situation and the fact that Texas Eastern no longer has the ability to further absorb imbalances being left on the system Texas Eastern requests that all customers coordinate with their suppliers the actual quantities received into the system match actual customer takes in the market area No due pipe gas will be accepted into the system until further notice If immediate action does not result in reducing the current volume of gas being left on the system Texas Eastern may be forced to issue an operational flow order OFO requiring actual receipts of gas to match actual deliveries out of the system which will be subject to the OFO noncompliance penalty of per dekatherm In addition and as provided for in Texas Easterns FERC Gas Tariff Texas Eastern will take any other actions as may be necessary to protect the integrity of its system including but not limited to suspension of OBAs NOTE Duke Energy Gas Transmission respects your online time and privacy You have received this email because you elected to subscribe To unsubscribe login to the Email Notification Subscription page at scriptNotificationasp uncheck the appropriate checkbox and click the Submit button
